intro: Ferraria purgans, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, often forming a rosette at the base. Ferraria purgans is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used for its purgative effects.
